statements: SELECT * FROM meteorological_data;
SELECT id, temperature FROM meteorological_data WHERE humidity > 50;
SELECT MAX(temperature) AS max_temp FROM meteorological_data;
SELECT AVG(humidity) AS avg_humidity, AVG(pressure) AS avg_pressure FROM meteorological_data;
SELECT id, pressure, rainfall FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature < 20 AND humidity < 70;
SELECT * FROM meteorological_data LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, temperature, humidity FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature > 25;
SELECT temperature, humidity, pressure FROM meteorological_data WHERE rainfall < 5 ORDER BY temperature DESC;
SELECT * FROM meteorological_data WHERE humidity >= 60 AND pressure < 1000;
SELECT id, temperature, humidity, pressure, rainfall FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature BETWEEN 20 AND 30 ORDER BY humidity ASC, pressure DESC;
SELECT * FROM meteorological_data WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT city, temperature, rainfall FROM meteorological_data ORDER BY temperature DESC;
SELECT city, humidity FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature > 25 AND rainfall < 10;
SELECT city, outbreak_date, affected_population FROM disease_outbreaks WHERE disease_name = 'Influenza' ORDER BY outbreak_date DESC;
SELECT city, disease_name FROM disease_outbreaks WHERE affected_population > 10000 ORDER BY affected_population DESC;
SELECT city, temperature, humidity FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature > 25 AND humidity < 70;
SELECT city, MAX(temperature) AS max_temperature, MIN(humidity) AS min_humidity FROM meteorological_data GROUP BY city;
SELECT city, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temperature, AVG(humidity) AS avg_humidity FROM meteorological_data WHERE rainfall > 0.5 GROUP BY city;
SELECT city, COUNT(*) AS total_outbreaks FROM disease_outbreaks GROUP BY city;
SELECT city, disease_name, outbreak_date FROM disease_outbreaks WHERE outbreak_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT * FROM meteorological_data ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, location, temperature FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature > 25 ORDER BY temperature DESC;
SELECT date, location, humidity FROM meteorological_data WHERE location = 'London';
SELECT * FROM disease_outbreaks WHERE cases > 100 ORDER BY date LIMIT 5;
SELECT date, description FROM environmental_changes WHERE change_type = 'Pollution' ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT * FROM meteorological_data ORDER BY temperature DESC, date ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT date, location, humidity FROM meteorological_data WHERE temperature > 25 AND humidity < 50 ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT location, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM meteorological_data GROUP BY location HAVING COUNT(*) > 10 ORDER BY avg_temp DESC;
SELECT d.location, e.change_type, d.date, e.description FROM disease_outbreaks d JOIN environmental_changes e ON d.location = e.location WHERE d.cases > 50 ORDER BY d.date DESC LIMIT 3;

SELECT d.location, d.date, d.disease, e.change_type FROM disease_outbreaks d LEFT JOIN environmental_changes e ON d.location = e.location AND d.date = e.date WHERE e.change_type = 'pollution' ORDER BY d.date ASC;
SELECT * FROM MeteorologicalData WHERE temperature > 30
SELECT date, humidity FROM MeteorologicalData WHERE humidity < 50
SELECT disease_name, affected_population FROM DiseaseOutbreaks WHERE affected_population > 1000
SELECT change_description FROM EnvironmentalChanges WHERE date >= '2022-01-01' AND date <= '2022-06-30'
SELECT d.disease_name, e.change_description, m.temperature FROM DiseaseOutbreaks d, EnvironmentalChanges e, MeteorologicalData m WHERE d.id = 1 AND e.id = 2 AND m.id = 3
SELECT id, date, temperature, humidity FROM MeteorologicalData WHERE temperature > 25 ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT date, disease_name, affected_population FROM DiseaseOutbreaks WHERE affected_population > 1000 ORDER BY date ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, date, change_description FROM EnvironmentalChanges WHERE LENGTH(change_description) > 50 ORDER BY id DESC;

SELECT D.disease_name, E.change_description, M.temperature, M.humidity FROM DiseaseOutbreaks D JOIN DataCorrelation DC ON D.id = DC.disease_id JOIN EnvironmentalChanges E ON E.id = DC.environmental_id JOIN MeteorologicalData M ON M.id = DC.meteorological_id WHERE M.temperature < 20 AND E.change_description LIKE '%rain%';
SELECT * FROM DiseaseOutbreaks UNION ALL SELECT * FROM EnvironmentalChanges UNION ALL SELECT * FROM MeteorologicalData;
SELECT * FROM MeteorologicalData
SELECT city_name, temperature, humidity FROM MeteorologicalData WHERE temperature > 25
SELECT city_name, wind_speed FROM MeteorologicalData ORDER BY wind_speed DESC
SELECT * FROM DiseaseOutbreaks WHERE affected_population > 1000
SELECT disease_name, outbreak_date FROM DiseaseOutbreaks ORDER BY outbreak_date
SELECT * FROM MeteorologicalData ORDER BY city_name DESC, temperature ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT city_name, temperature, humidity FROM MeteorologicalData WHERE temperature > 30 AND humidity < 50;
SELECT AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp, AVG(humidity) AS avg_humidity FROM MeteorologicalData GROUP BY city_name HAVING avg_temp > 25 AND avg_humidity > 60;

SELECT d.disease_name, o.outbreak_date, o.affected_population FROM DiseaseOutbreaks AS d JOIN CorrelationData AS c ON d.id = c.outbreak_id JOIN Locations AS l ON l.id = c.meteorological_id WHERE l.latitude < 0;
SELECT c.correlation_score, e.change_type, e.change_date FROM CorrelationData AS c JOIN EnvironmentalChanges AS e ON c.change_id = e.id ORDER BY c.correlation_score DESC;
